verses.verse: Two days later was the Passover and Feast of Unleavened Bread, and the chief priests and scribes sought how they could get take him by deceit and kill him.
But they said, "Not during the feast, lest their be an uproar by the people."

And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat to eat, a woman came having an alabaster flask of ointment of very expensive, pure spikenard, and she broke the flask and poured it out on his head.
There were some there who got angry inside themselves and said, "Why was this waste of perfumed oil made?"
"For it could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor." And they got really angry with her.
And Jesus said, "Leave her alone; why do you trouble her? She has done a beautiful thing for me.
"For you will always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to you can do something good for them, but you don't always have me.
"She has done what she could; she has come beforehand to anoint my body for burying.
"Truly I say to you: Wherever this gospel will be preached throughout the whole world, this also what she has done will be mentioned in memorial of her."
Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray him to them.
When they heard it, they were very happy and promised to give him money. He sought how he could conveniently betray him.
The first day of Unleavened Beard, when they killed the Passover, his disciples said to him, "Where do you want us to go and prepare, so that you can eat the Passover?"
He sent two of his disciples and said to them, "Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a water pitcher. Follow him.
"Wherever he goes in, say to the owner of the house, «The master says, "Where is your guest room, where I will eat the Passover with my disciples?»
"And he will show you a large, upper room furnished and prepared. Make ready for us there."
His disciples went, came into the city, and found just as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
In the evening he came with the twelve.
As they sat and ate, Jesus said, "Truly I say to you that one of you, who eats with me, will betray me."
They started to get very sad and said to him one by one, "Is it I?" And another said, "Is it I?"
And he answered and said to them, "It is one of the twelve who dips with me in the dish.
"The Son of Man truly goes just as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed. It would have been better for that man if he had never been born."
As they ate Jesus took bread, blessed it, broke it, gave it to them, and said, "Take, eat; this is my body."
He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
Then he said to them, "This is my blood of the New Covenant, which is being shed for many.
"Truly I say to you that I will drink no more from the fruit of the vine until that day that I drink it new in the Kingdom of God."
After they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Jesus said to them, "All of you are going to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written: I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.
"But after I am risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee."
But Peter said to him, "Even if all will be offended, yet I won't."
But Jesus said to him, "Truly I say to you that today, even this night, before the rooster crows two times, you will deny me three times."
But he spoke with even more boldly, "If I should die with you, I will not deny you in any way." So they all said.
They then came to a place, which was named Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples, "Sit here, while I pray."
And he took with him Peter, James, and John and started to be very depressed and distressed.
And he said to them, "My soul is extremely sad, even to death; stay here and keep watch."
He went forward a little more and dropped to the ground and prayed that if it were possible, this hour might pass from him.
And he said, "Abba, Father, all things are possible to you, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless not what I want, but what you want."
And he came and found them sleeping and said to Peter, "Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn't you keep watch for one hour?"
"Keep watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit is truly willing, but the flesh is weak."
Again he went away, prayed, and spoke the same words.
When he returned he found them sleeping again, for their eyelids were heavy, neither did they know how to answer him.
He came the third time and said to them, "Sleep now and rest, it is enough for now. The time has come; look! The Son on Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
"Get up, let us go; look! He who betrays me is almost here."
Immediately while he still spoke, Judas, one of the twelve, came along with a large group with swords and clubs. [They came] from the chief priests, scribes, and the elders.
He who betrayed him had given them a sign, telling them, "Whomever I kiss; that one is him, take him, and lead him away securely."
As soon as he had come, he went up to him right away and said, "Master, master", and kissed him.
Then they laid their hands on him and took him.
One of those who stood there drew a sword, struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
Jesus answered and said to them, "Have you come out, as if against a thief with swords and clubs to take me?
"I was with you every day in the temple teaching, yet you didn't take me, but the Scriptures must be fulfilled."
Then they all forsook him and fled.
A certain young man who followed him was there having [only] a linen cloth thrown around his naked body, and the young men grabbed him,
but he left the linen cloth and ran away from them naked.
They led Jesus away to the High Priest. All the chief priests, elders, and scribes were assembled with him.
Peter followed him for a long way even to the palace of the High Priest, and he sat with the servants and warmed himself at the fire.
The chief priests and the whole council looked for witnesses against Jesus, in order to have him put to death but found none.
For many bare false testimony against him, but their witness didn't agree with each other.
And a certain one there got up and gave false witness against him saying,
"We heard him say, «I will destroy this temple that is made with hands and within three days I will build another one made without hands.»
But neither did their witness agree with each other.
Then the High Priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, saying, "Aren't you going to give an answer? What is this which these witness against you?"
But he remained quiet and gave no answer. Again the High Priest asked him and said to him, "Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed?"
And Jesus said, "I am, and you will see the Son of Man sitting on the right hand of power and coming in the clouds of heaven."
Then the High Priest tore his clothes and said, "What need do we have of any more witnesses?
"You heard the blasphemy. What do you think?" And they all condemned him to be worthy of death.
Some started to spit on him, blindfold his face, slug him, and say to him, "Prophesy." The servants slapped him with the palms of their hands.
Peter was under the palace, and there came one of the servant girls of the high priest.
And when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him and said, "You were with Jesus of Nazareth, too."
But he denied and said, "I don't know or understand what you are talking about." He went out to the porch, and the rooster crew.
Then a maid saw him again and started to say to those who stood by, "This is one of them."
He denied again. A little while later those who stood by said to Peter, "Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean. And your way of speaking agrees with it."
But he started to curse and take oaths, "I don't know this man you are talking about."
The rooster crew a second time, and Peter remembered the word that Jesus said to him: "Before the rooster crow two times, you will deny me three times". When this thought hit him, he started to cry.
